content: शकुनिः [शक्-उनि] {@--1@} A bird; तरुशकुनिकुरंगान् मैथिली यानपुष्यत् <ls>U. 3. 25</ls>; <ls>Ms. 12. 63.</ls> {@--2@} A vulture, kite or eagle. {@--3@} A cock. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of a son of Subala, king of Gāndhāra and brother of Gāndhārī, wife of Dhṛtarāṣṭra; he was thus the maternal uncle of Duryodhana whom he assisted in many of his wicked schemes to exterminate the Pāṇḍavas. The name is now usually applied to an old wicked-minded relative whose counsels tend to ruin. {@--5@} <ab>N.</ab> of a demon killed by Kṛṣṇa.
